DESCRIPTION.P: This block realizes the visualization of the evolution of the two regular input signals by drawing the second input as a function of the first at instants of events on the event input port.

ITEM.label: Curve colors
ITEM.SP: : an integer. It is the color number (>0) or dash type (<0) used to draw the evolution of the input port signal. See plot2d for color (dash type) definitions.

ITEM.label: Output window number
ITEM.SP: : The number of graphic window used for the display. It is often good to use high values to avoid conflict with palettes and Super Block windows. If you have more than one scope, make sure they don't have the same window numbers (unless superposition of the curves is desired).

ITEM.label: Output window position
ITEM.SP: : a 2 vector specifying the coordinates of the upper left corner of the graphic window. Answer [] for default window position.

ITEM.label: Output window size
ITEM.SP: : a 2 vector specifying the width and height of the graphic window. Answer [] for default window dimensions.

ITEM.label: Xmin, Xmax
ITEM.SP: : Minimum and maximum values of the first input; used to set up the X-axis of the plot in the graphics window.

ITEM.label: Ymin, Ymax
ITEM.SP: : Minimum and maximum values of the second input; used to set up the Y-axis of the plot in the graphics window.

ITEM.label: Buffer size
ITEM.SP: : To improve efficiency it is possible to buffer the input data. The drawing is only done after each Buffer size call to the block.

SECTION.label: Remarks
SECTION.P: Output window number, Output window size, Output window position are only taken into account at the initialisation time of the simulation.
